meanings.definition: A series of related events or actions.
meanings.sent1: The sequencies in the story made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: The sequencies of the movie scenes were well planned.
meanings.sent3: The sequencies of events at the party led to a surprising outcome.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a series of sequencies, each leading to the next.
meanings.sent5: The sequencies of colors in the painting created a harmonious flow.

meanings.definition: The order in which things follow each other.
meanings.sent1: Following the sequencies of steps in the recipe is crucial for success.
meanings.sent2: The sequencies of numbers must be arranged correctly in the sequence.
meanings.sent3: The sequencies of cars in the traffic jam seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent4: The sequencies of waves crashing onto the shore were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: Remember to follow the sequencies of instructions to assemble the furniture.

meanings.definition: The quality of being sequent or following in order.
meanings.sent1: The sequencies of the melody gave the song a smooth flow.
meanings.sent2: His speech lacked the sequencies needed to convey his message clearly.
meanings.sent3: The sequencies of flavors in the dish were perfectly balanced.
meanings.sent4: The sequencies of thoughts in her mind were organized and logical.
meanings.sent5: The sequencies of events in history shaped the course of nations.
